page.title: 03FARMING ON ALSTON MOOR (1)
page.content: SHEEP. {Scottish Blackface}and{Swaledale}sheep are the most popular around Alston Moor because they are the most profitable on hill land. The most popular rams are the {Bluefaced Leicester}and Swaledale whose progeny are much sought after by buyers from the south, who come up and buy the lambs cheaper than they could buy a lowland breed. The Bluefaced Leicester is favoured by the farmer whose land is on the lower fells.The ram lambs are usually castrated and sent away to be fattened for meat. The Swaledale ram is for the farmer with very rough fell land who wants to keep some of the (Gimmer) female lambs to maintain the numbers in the flock.Sheepdogs are absolutely essential on a hill farm.
